page.title: 01Location
page.content: This area is located centally on a prominent ridge of boulder clay which runs north- south along the county boundary.The landscape is a series of ridges and valleys drained by brooks which flow eastwards and are tributaries of the R.Ouse. The area is entirely agricultural-intensive arable farming, which gives open views of the surrounding countryside and across the fields to the Bedford-Kempston urban area.There is no major concentration of popultion-just the south-western end of Stagsden High Street,the remaining population living in about 12 farms.The A 422 crosses the northern part and through Stagsden for which a By-Pass is proposed,inevitably meaning loss of agricultural land.
